ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned chemistry in the context of geology and different aspects of geology (fossil fuels, environmental health, sustainability)
This class is divided into two halves; during the first half, you cover/review basic chemistry and basic geography, while during the second you discuss the health implications of mineralogy.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I found the material to be very interesting and the guest lecturers were so good! However, there is zero organization to the class. Most classes my classmates and I were wondering what was going on. If the assignments were clearer and the lectures more thought out, that would drastically improve the class
Strengths: small class size; fascinating guest lecturers Weaknesses: lack of clear expectations and organization in the course

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Unfortunately I wouldn't recommend this course. It's a chill class but Professor Blake has no organization. I think the material (especially anything taught by the guest lecturers) was really interesting but the lack of structure of the class really takes away from the learning experience

I would recommend this course to individuals who are okay never knowing what was going to happen. I would also recommend this to students if they have a strong background or affinity for chemistry. I was disappointed that we really didn't discuss health until the very end. I personally struggled writing the first 10 pg. paper because I had no experience with college-level chemistry and didn't know how to write a chemistry paper.
